page.title: 10Shopping\Barby\Willoughby
page.content: Both villages are served by small shops. Barby has a Post Office, a garage, two grocers, a butchers shop and a nursery garden but a survey has shown that people prefer to shop in the neighbouring towns. The village shops are generally used only as a back up facility. Prices in the village shops are higher but this may be offset by a saving in transport costs. Our survey has found that 56% of the consumers shop in Rugby, 14% shop in Daventry, 16% shop in Northampton and 14% shop in Coventry. Occasionally people travel to Milton Keynes, Birmingham, Leamington and London and some people shop through mail order catalogues.
